docs.abstract: European economies that depend on tourism, small businesses and supply chains may suffer the most. At the other end may be Estonia.
docs.snippet: European economies that depend on tourism, small businesses and supply chains may suffer the most. At the other end may be Estonia.
docs.lead_paragraph: No European country is escaping the economic consequences of the coronavirus, but the pain won’t be divided equally.

headline.main: Some Countries Are Better Armored for Epidemics Than Others
headline.print_headline: Pandemic’s Spread Exploits Weak Spots in European Economies

docs.abstract: Stocks remained volatile even as governments took steps to offset the sharp decline gripping their economies.
docs.snippet: Stocks remained volatile even as governments took steps to offset the sharp decline gripping their economies.
docs.lead_paragraph: This briefing is no longer updating. Read the latest developments in the coronavirus outbreak here.

headline.main: Stocks Inch Higher as Wall Street’s Turmoil Continues
headline.print_headline: Turbulent Session Ends With a Small Gain

docs.abstract: Policymakers are bending previously sacred rules to mitigate economic disaster unleashed by the coronavirus. Will it be enough?
docs.snippet: Policymakers are bending previously sacred rules to mitigate economic disaster unleashed by the coronavirus. Will it be enough?
docs.lead_paragraph: Don’t worry about government deficits so much and start spending. Get ready to use the “big bazooka” by issuing eurobonds. Drop cash from the sky.

headline.main: Will ‘Helicopter Money’ and the ‘Big Bazooka’ Help Rescue Europe?
headline.print_headline: Can Euro Airdrops and a ‘Big Bazooka’ Rescue the E.U.?

byline.original: By Matina Stevis-Gridneff and Jack Ewing

docs.abstract: Goldman Sachs, a punching bag during the last economic catastrophe, is leading the way as the coronavirus outbreak threatens consumers’ livelihoods. Ally Bank, a bailout beneficiary last time, hasn’t matched it.
docs.snippet: Goldman Sachs, a punching bag during the last economic catastrophe, is leading the way as the coronavirus outbreak threatens consumers’ livelihoods. Ally Bank, a bailout beneficiary last time, hasn’t matched it.
docs.lead_paragraph: On Sunday morning, Goldman Sachs, the financial partner on the new Apple credit card, said it would allow all cardholders who asked for help to skip their March credit card bill. The interest would disappear, never to be charged. And Goldman would foot the bill itself, as the financial backer of the partnership.

headline.main: Which Consumer Lenders Are (and Aren’t) Helping the Most
headline.print_headline: Big Lenders Slow To Promise Relief

docs.abstract: The central bank will buy short-term promissory notes, known as commercial paper, a move it made during the 2008 financial crisis.
docs.snippet: The central bank will buy short-term promissory notes, known as commercial paper, a move it made during the 2008 financial crisis.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve took a series of steps on Tuesday to prop up the American economy, saying first that it would begin buying up a type of debt that companies issue for short-term cash and then, later in the day, establishing a lending program meant to help the banks at the core of the financial system function smoothly.

headline.main: Fed Unveils Emergency Lending Programs as Companies Struggle to Raise Cash
headline.print_headline: Fed Acts to Keep Credit Flowing

byline.original: By Jeanna Smialek, Kate Kelly and Peter Eavis

docs.abstract: As China grappled with the coronavirus, it kept the masks it made. Now that other nations need them, pressure is rising on Beijing to resume exports.
docs.snippet: As China grappled with the coronavirus, it kept the masks it made. Now that other nations need them, pressure is rising on Beijing to resume exports.
docs.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — As hospitals and governments hunt desperately for respirators and surgical masks to protect doctors and nurses from the coronavirus pandemic, they face a difficult reality: The world depends on China to make them, and the country is only beginning to share.

headline.main: The World Needs Masks. China Makes Them — But Has Been Hoarding Them.
headline.print_headline: China Makes the Masks the World Needs. It Is Just Starting to Share.

byline.original: By Keith Bradsher and Liz Alderman

docs.abstract: The Communist Party is trying to fill the airwaves with positive stories about its battle against the virus. Chinese reporters, buoyed by widespread calls for free speech, are resisting.
docs.snippet: The Communist Party is trying to fill the airwaves with positive stories about its battle against the virus. Chinese reporters, buoyed by widespread calls for free speech, are resisting.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Jacob Wang saw reports circulating online recently suggesting that life was getting better in Wuhan, the center of the coronavirus outbreak, he was irate.

headline.main: As China Cracks Down on Coronavirus Coverage, Journalists Fight Back
headline.print_headline: As China Tries to Stifle Coverage, Defiant Journalists Do Exposés

docs.abstract: In ordinary times, Mr. Cuomo’s relentlessness and bullying drive New Yorkers crazy. In the age of the coronavirus, they soothe our battered nerves.
docs.snippet: In ordinary times, Mr. Cuomo’s relentlessness and bullying drive New Yorkers crazy. In the age of the coronavirus, they soothe our battered nerves.
docs.lead_paragraph: “A crisis shows you a person’s soul,” Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo mused during a conference call with reporters on Sunday. “It shows you what they’re made of. The weaknesses explode and the strengths are, uh, emboldened.”

headline.main: Andrew Cuomo Is the Control Freak We Need Right Now
headline.print_headline: The Ever Abrasive, and Suddenly Apt, Governor Cuomo

docs.abstract: Mr. Hanks is not like other movie stars, and that showed in the way people reacted to his announcement that he was infected.
docs.snippet: Mr. Hanks is not like other movie stars, and that showed in the way people reacted to his announcement that he was infected.
docs.lead_paragraph: Tom Hanks has never been like other Hollywood celebrities.

headline.main: When Tom Hanks, Hollywood’s Everyman, Gets Coronavirus

docs.abstract: Some large businesses are paying employees while they stay home. Others are offering bonuses to those who must keep going in.
docs.snippet: Some large businesses are paying employees while they stay home. Others are offering bonuses to those who must keep going in.
docs.lead_paragraph: A thousand dollars here, $200 there, free lunch once a week, stipends for electronic equipment: Those are some of the ways the biggest companies in the United States have come up with to help their employees get through the coronavirus crisis.

headline.main: As Crisis Deepens, Companies Hand Out Cash to Workers
headline.print_headline: With Crisis Growing More Dire,  Some Employers Hand Out Cash
